name: Hollow Knight

reviews:
A game full of bugs. Real bugs🐛🐞🐝🦗🦋
Bought the game because of its reputation, it lived up to that reputation implied. 
I was lost at first because the game doesn't tell you where to go or what to do, no map at the initial stage. Was super confused so I just jumped around, fought a few bugs, collected badges, learnt a new skill, next time I noticed the clock was 2am. What's wrong with me.

If you explore the game thoroughly you can sink hundreds of hours into it. Lots of secrets, NPCs, badges, skills and enemies to collect and discover (I love that). You can see the devs have put a lot of effort into making this game by its astonishing content.
It's a steal even buying it at full price💲. I feel sorry (well not that sorry) I bought it at 50% off.

PS. Parkour in this game is freaking hard, imo harder than boss fight.
PPS. 🎉🎉Heard that Silksong is coming in 2025. Hype me up.🥂

300 hours. All achievements. These numbers don't even begin to scratch the surface of my experience with Hollow Knight. This wasn't just a game I played; it was a world I inhabited, a journey I poured my heart into. From the moment I stepped into Hallownest's melancholic beauty, I was captivated.

The sheer artistry is breathtaking. Every pixel, every animation, every haunting melody breathes life into this decaying kingdom. The atmosphere is thick with mystery, a palpable sense of loss and wonder that pulls you deeper with each step. But it's not just pretty; it's challenging, rewarding, and deeply, deeply satisfying.

The combat is a dance of precise timing and skillful parrying. Each boss battle felt like a personal triumph, a testament to my patience and dedication. The exploration is unparalleled; every hidden nook and cranny holds a secret, a treasure, a piece of the puzzle that is Hallownest's tragic history. I found myself constantly losing myself in its intricate map, always discovering something new, something breathtaking.

More than just a game, Hollow Knight is an experience. It's a testament to the power of atmosphere, the thrill of challenge, and the beauty of exploration. It's a game that has stayed with me long after I 'completed' it, a world I still revisit in my thoughts. If you're looking for a game that will challenge you, move you, and leave a lasting impression, look no further. This is a masterpiece, and I wholeheartedly recommend it.

9/10 – Must-play as it probably is the best metroidvania souls-like out there.

Pros:
- Good and challenging combat
- Good visuals and art
- Amazing soundtrack
- Deep lore
- Tons of hidden places and secrets
- Great boss design
- A lot of customization with charms
- Huge map with lots to explore

Cons:
- Too much backtracking
- Confusing and hard to know where you should go(yes, even for a souls-like)

I’ve never been much of a platformer fan, to be honest—but Hollow Knight is a rare exception. Though it may be a 2D game, it carries more depth than many big-budget 3D titles. If you have an adventurous spirit, enjoy a good challenge, are looking for an emotional story, find satisfaction in patterns, and love getting lost in beautifully crafted worlds (not to mention skulking through shadowy corridors XD), this is an experience you shouldn’t miss. I often find myself wishing I could discover it all over again—for the very first time. Ah well - guess it's time to start another playthrough. :p

I have heard about this game for years and always thought of it as something I'd like to play because I was a big fan of Symphony of the Night and Metroid Dread.  This is absolutely a super fun game that I would recommend to any fan of Metroidvania style games AS LONG AS you're ready for a REALLY tough challenge.  There are some challenges towards the end of the game that will REALLY test your patience but as long as you're persistent, you'll find the right means of dealing with the obstacles and bosses that you'll face.  

Definitely lives up to the hype in terms of super tight gameplay and very well done visuals that have a timeless look about it that will most certainly age well over time.  I'm also not the usual type of person to go for games this hard but it was fun enough of a game that it was worth getting to the finish line in the main game with the ending that required the most work.

short_description: Forge your own path in Hollow Knight! An epic action adventure through a vast ruined kingdom of insects and heroes. Explore twisting caverns, battle tainted creatures and befriend bizarre bugs, all in a classic, hand-drawn 2D style.
